-0.#desc: specify record separator (\0, if no argument)

-c.#desc: check syntax only (runs BEGIN and CHECK blocks)

-D.#desc: set debugging flags (argument is a bit mask or alphabets)

-e.#desc: one line of program (several -e's allowed, omit programfile)

-E.#desc: like -e, but enables all optional features

-F.#desc: split() pattern for -a switch (//'s are optional)

-i.#desc: edit <> files in place (makes backup if extension supplied)

-l.#desc: enable line ending processing, specifies line terminator

-p.#desc: assume loop like -n but print line also, like sed

-s.#desc: enable rudimentary parsing for switches after programfile

-S.#desc: look for programfile using PATH environment variable

-V.#desc: print configuration summary (or a single Config.pm variable)

-x.#desc: ignore text before #!perl line (optionally cd to directory)
